author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the guidelines for auto-merging. Please make sure that you have read the [General registry README](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md). The following guidelines were not met:

- I was not able to install the package (i.e. `Pkg.add("XCBased")` failed). See the CI logs for details.
- I was not able to load the package (i.e. `import XCBased` failed). See the CI logs for details.

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

After you have fixed the AutoMerge issues, simple retrigger Registrator, which will automatically update this pull request. You do not need to change the version number in your `Project.toml` file (unless of course the AutoMerge issue is that you skipped a version number, in which case you should change the version number).

If you do not want to fix the AutoMerge issues, please post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have also read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

@MasFlam [this line](https://github.com/MasFlam/XCBased.jl/blob/81444aa4dd7143f74b0c38fde638e4280602fab6/Project.toml#L13) should be
```toml
julia = "1.5.0"
```
You're currently claiming that the package is compatible only with Julia v1.5.x.  See [Pkg documentation](https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/v1/compatibility/#Tilde-specifiers) for more details about the meaning of the tilde specifier.

Please, fix the compat with julia _without changing the version number of the package_ and register again, so that this pull request will be automatically updated

[noblock]

I have already created another tag/release on the GitHub repo though, so I think I'll just maybe close this pull request and use Registrator to register the newer one along with the Project.toml changed, is that okay?
[noblock]

It wasn't necessary to change the version number, but it's OK.

Note that git tags/releases should be created _**after**_ registration, this avoids inconsistencies with the registry in case something needs to be changed (as it happened for example in this case).  [TagBot](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/TagBot) is a useful GitHub Action workflow which creates automatically the tag/release for you, to be sure to keep them in sync with the registry
Is there a way for me to close this pull request, or can I just use Registrator to create a new one?
You can use registrator to start a new one. I'm going to close this

body:

title: New package: XCBased v0.1.1
